description.narrative: The overall strategy is to address one of the key factors leading to social exclusion of PwDs in the society, i.e. the societal and institutional medical approach to people with disabilities, which considers disability as individual deficiency.

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Outcome indicator 1.1 Improved inclusive and gender sensitive legislation and policy ensuring the rights of all PwDs Output indicator 1.2.4 Number of CSO, Women’s organizations and PwD representatives capacitated to advocate and monitor implementation of th;e rights of women with disabilities, including GBV and SRHR Output indicator 1.3.1 The capacity of SSA, private sector and local municipalities to promote employment of PwDs strengthened Outcome indicator 2.2 Systems strengthened to provide rights based social services, SRH and GBV integrated services for PwDs, including women and young persons with disabilities Output Indicator 2.2.3 New social services for PwDs introduced in selected municipalities

comment.narrative: 1.1. In cooperation with the Parliament of Georgia, UNDP elaborated the Guideline on Web-Accessibility for People with Disabilities in Georgia. To support implementation of LRPD UNDP held a working meeting with the participation of representatives from Parliament, Government’s Administration, line ministries and other state agencies. Conducted trainings for up to 100 representatives of the General Prosecutor’s Office and the Ministry of Finance on the Rights of Persons with Disabilities. Supporting the Ministry of Internal Affairs to upgrade training modules and conducting the ToT on psychological aspects and communication standards with PwDs for the Academy of Ministry of Internal Affairs of Georgia 1.2. Supporting the Office of Public Defender of Georgia to perform its functions as a National Monitoring Mechanism of the CRPD. Among other activities, together with the PDO, UNDP conducted the assessment of State Social Rehabilitation Programmes for Persons with disabilities and the monitoring of provision of mental health services during COVID-19. 1.3. The Social Inclusion Center in Ambrolauri was established. The main function of the Center is provision of space for social activities and professional skills development for PwDs. 2.2. Supported strengthening Social Services for PwDs in Akhaltshikhe and Shuakhevi municipalities. The national expert elaborated guideline on providing social services and conducted trainings on delivery of rehabilitation services for up to 100 representatives of local self-government bodies of selected Municipalities. In order to support the implementation of the standards UNDP conduced series of trainings for up to 300 personnel of architecture, infrastructure, supervision and urban development unites of municipalities of Georgia. Module on Accessibility standards was elaborated for the HEIs. UNDP works with them to incorporate in their study curricula.
